translated: Translated by Tripiá¹­aka Master Xuanzang on Imperial Order
At that time, Åšakra, Lord of the Devas, had this thought:
Venerable SubhÅ«ti's wisdom is very profound. He speaks of the nature of dharmas without destroying conventional names.
The Buddha knew his thoughts and approved his words, saying:
Just as KauÅ›ika has thought, SubhÅ«ti's wisdom is very profound. He speaks of the nature of dharmas without destroying conventional names.
Then Åšakra, Lord of the Devas, said to the Buddha:
In what dharmas does Venerable SubhÅ«ti not destroy conventional names while speaking of the nature of dharmas?

Form is merely a conventional name, feeling, perception, formation, and consciousness are merely conventional names. Such conventional names are not apart from the nature of dharmas. SubhÅ«ti does not destroy such conventional names for form, etc. while speaking of the nature of dharmas such as form.
The nature of form and other dharmas is neither destroyed nor not destroyed, therefore SubhÅ«ti's explanation is also neither destroyed nor not destroyed.

The eye sense base is merely a nominal designation, the ear, nose, tongue, body, and mind sense bases are merely nominal designations. Such nominal designations are not apart from the nature of dharmas. Venerable SubhÅ«ti does not destroy such nominal designations as the eye sense base, etc., but explains the nature of dharmas such as the eye sense base, etc.
The nature of dharmas such as the eye sense base, etc., is neither destroyed nor not destroyed, therefore SubhÅ«ti's explanation is also neither destroyed nor not destroyed.

The form sense base is merely a nominal designation, the sound, smell, taste, touch, and dharma sense bases are merely nominal designations. Such nominal designations are not apart from the nature of dharmas. Venerable SubhÅ«ti does not destroy such nominal designations as the form sense base, etc., but explains the nature of dharmas such as the form sense base, etc.
The nature of dharmas such as the form sense base, etc., is neither destroyed nor not destroyed, therefore SubhÅ«ti's explanation is also neither destroyed nor not destroyed.

The eye realm is merely a provisional name, the form realm, eye consciousness realm, eye contact, and the various feelings produced by eye contact as a condition are merely provisional names. Such provisional names are not apart from the nature of dharmas. The Venerable SubhÅ«ti does not destroy such provisional names as the eye realm, etc., but speaks of the nature of dharmas such as the eye realm, etc.
The nature of dharmas such as the eye realm, etc., is without destruction and without non-destruction. Therefore, what SubhÅ«ti speaks is also without destruction and without non-destruction.

The ear realm is merely a provisional name, the sound realm, ear consciousness realm, ear contact, and the various feelings produced by ear contact as a condition are merely provisional names. Such provisional names are not apart from the nature of dharmas. The Venerable SubhÅ«ti does not destroy such provisional names as the ear realm, etc., but speaks of the nature of dharmas such as the ear realm, etc.
The nature of dharmas such as the ear realm, etc., is without destruction and without non-destruction. Therefore, what SubhÅ«ti speaks is also without destruction and without non-destruction.

The nose realm is merely a provisional name, the nose consciousness realm and the nose contact, and the various feelings produced by nose contact as a condition are merely provisional names. Such provisional names are not apart from the nature of dharmas. The Venerable SubhÅ«ti does not destroy such provisional names as the nose realm, etc., but speaks of the nature of dharmas such as the nose realm.
The nature of dharmas such as the nose realm is neither destroyed nor not destroyed. Therefore, what SubhÅ«ti speaks is also neither destroyed nor not destroyed.

The tongue realm is merely a provisional name, the taste realm, the tongue consciousness realm, and the tongue contact, and the various feelings produced by tongue contact as a condition are merely provisional names. Such provisional names are not apart from the nature of dharmas. The Venerable SubhÅ«ti does not destroy such provisional names as the tongue realm, etc., but speaks of the nature of dharmas such as the tongue realm.
The nature of dharmas such as the tongue realm is neither destroyed nor not destroyed. Therefore, what SubhÅ«ti speaks is also neither destroyed nor not destroyed.

The body element is merely a nominal designation, the touch element, body consciousness element, and body contact, as well as the feelings produced from the condition of body contact, are merely nominal designations. Such nominal designations are not apart from the nature of dharmas. The Venerable SubhÅ«ti does not destroy the nominal designations of the body element, etc., but speaks of the nature of dharmas of the body element, etc.
The nature of dharmas of the body element, etc., is neither destroyed nor not destroyed. Therefore, what SubhÅ«ti speaks is also neither destroyed nor not destroyed.

The mind element is merely a nominal designation, the dharma element, mind consciousness element, and mind contact, as well as the feelings produced from the condition of mind contact, are merely nominal designations. Such nominal designations are not apart from the nature of dharmas. The Venerable SubhÅ«ti does not destroy the nominal designations of the mind element, etc., but speaks of the nature of dharmas of the mind element, etc.
The nature of dharmas of the mind element, etc., is neither destroyed nor not destroyed. Therefore, what SubhÅ«ti speaks is also neither destroyed nor not destroyed.

The earth element is merely a designation, the water, fire, wind, space, and consciousness elements are merely designations. Such designations are not apart from the nature of dharmas. The Venerable SubhÅ«ti does not destroy such designations as the earth element, etc., but speaks of the nature of dharmas such as the earth element.
The nature of dharmas such as the earth element is neither destroyed nor not destroyed. Therefore, what SubhÅ«ti speaks is also neither destroyed nor not destroyed.

The noble truth of suffering is merely a designation, the noble truths of the arising, cessation, and path are merely designations. Such designations are not apart from the nature of dharmas. The Venerable SubhÅ«ti does not destroy such designations as the noble truth of suffering, etc., but speaks of the nature of dharmas such as the noble truth of suffering.
The nature of dharmas such as the noble truth of suffering is neither destroyed nor not destroyed. Therefore, what SubhÅ«ti speaks is also neither destroyed nor not destroyed.

Ignorance is merely a designation, and formations, consciousness, name-and-form, the six sense bases, contact, feeling, craving, grasping, becoming, birth, aging, death, sorrow, lamentation, pain, distress, and anguish are merely designations. Such designations are not separate from the nature of dharmas. The Venerable SubhÅ«ti does not destroy these designations of ignorance, etc., but speaks of the nature of dharmas such as ignorance.
The nature of dharmas such as ignorance is neither destroyed nor not destroyed. Therefore, what SubhÅ«ti says is also neither destroyed nor not destroyed.

Inner emptiness is merely a designation, and outer emptiness, inner and outer emptiness, emptiness of emptiness, great emptiness, ultimate emptiness, emptiness of conditioned phenomena, emptiness of unconditioned phenomena, absolute emptiness, emptiness without beginning or end, emptiness of non-dispersal, emptiness of inherent nature, emptiness of specific characteristics, emptiness of general characteristics, emptiness of all phenomena, emptiness of non-apprehension, emptiness of intrinsic nature, emptiness of intrinsic nature of non-existence, and emptiness of the intrinsic nature of non-existence are also merely designations. Such designations are not apart from the nature of dharmas. Venerable SubhÅ«ti does not destroy these designations such as inner emptiness and so forth, but speaks of the nature of dharmas such as inner emptiness and so forth.
The nature of dharmas such as inner emptiness and so forth is without destruction and without non-destruction. Therefore, what SubhÅ«ti speaks is also without destruction and without non-destruction.

Suchness is merely a provisional name, as are the dharma realm, dharma nature, non-false nature, unchanging nature, equality nature, birthlessness nature, dharma determination, dharma abode, reality limit, space element, and inconceivable element. Such provisional names are not apart from the dharma nature. Venerable SubhÅ«ti does not destroy such provisional names as suchness and so forth, yet he speaks of the dharma nature of suchness and so forth.
The dharma nature of suchness and so forth is neither destroyed nor not destroyed. Therefore, what SubhÅ«ti says is also neither destroyed nor not destroyed.

The perfection of generosity is merely a provisional name, as are the perfections of morality, patience, diligence, concentration, and wisdom. Such provisional names are not apart from the dharma nature. Venerable SubhÅ«ti does not destroy such provisional names as the perfection of generosity and so forth, yet he speaks of the dharma nature of the perfection of generosity and so forth.
The nature of the perfection of giving and so forth is indestructible and not indestructible, therefore what SubhÅ«ti says is also indestructible and not indestructible.

The four meditations are merely names, the four immeasurable [minds] and four formless concentrations are merely names. Such names are not apart from the nature of dharmas. Venerable SubhÅ«ti does not destroy such names as the four meditations and so forth, yet he speaks of the nature of dharmas of the four meditations and so forth.
The nature of dharmas of the four meditations and so forth is indestructible and not indestructible, therefore what SubhÅ«ti says is also indestructible and not indestructible.

The eight liberations are merely names, the eight dominant spheres, nine sequential concentrations, and ten universal bases are merely names. Such names are not apart from the nature of dharmas. Venerable SubhÅ«ti does not destroy such names as the eight liberations and so forth, yet he speaks of the nature of dharmas of the eight liberations and so forth.
The nature of the eight liberations and so forth is neither destroyed nor not destroyed, therefore SubhÅ«ti's explanations are also neither destroyed nor not destroyed.

The four establishments of mindfulness are merely provisional names, the four right efforts, four bases of supernatural power, five faculties, five powers, seven factors of enlightenment, and eightfold noble path are merely provisional names. Such provisional names are not apart from the nature of dharmas. Venerable SubhÅ«ti does not destroy such provisional names as the four establishments of mindfulness and so forth, yet he explains the nature of dharmas of the four establishments of mindfulness and so forth.
The nature of dharmas such as the four establishments of mindfulness is neither destroyed nor not destroyed, therefore SubhÅ«ti's explanations are also neither destroyed nor not destroyed.

The emptiness liberation gate is merely a provisional name, the signless and wishless liberation gates are merely provisional names. Such provisional names are not apart from the nature of dharmas. Venerable SubhÅ«ti does not destroy such provisional names as the emptiness liberation gate and so forth, yet he explains the nature of dharmas of the emptiness liberation gate and so forth.
The nature of the gate of emptiness and so forth is neither destroyed nor indestructible, therefore SubhÅ«ti's words are also neither destroyed nor indestructible.

The five eyes are merely provisional names, the six supernormal knowledges are merely provisional names, such provisional names are not apart from the nature of dharmas, the Venerable SubhÅ«ti does not destroy such provisional names as the five eyes and so forth, yet he speaks of the nature of dharmas such as the five eyes and so forth.
The nature of dharmas such as the five eyes is neither destroyed nor indestructible, therefore SubhÅ«ti's words are also neither destroyed nor indestructible.

The ten powers of a Buddha are merely provisional names, the four fearlessnesses, the four unobstructed understandings, great kindness, great compassion, great joy, great equanimity, and the eighteen distinctive qualities of a Buddha are merely provisional names, such provisional names are not apart from the nature of dharmas, the Venerable SubhÅ«ti does not destroy such provisional names as the ten powers of a Buddha and so forth, yet he speaks of the nature of dharmas such as the ten powers of a Buddha and so forth.
The nature of the dharmas such as the ten powers of the Buddha is indestructible and not indestructible, therefore what SubhÅ«ti says is also indestructible and not indestructible.

The dharma of non-forgetfulness is merely a provisional name, the dharma of constant relinquishment is merely a provisional name, such provisional names are not apart from the nature of dharmas, the Venerable SubhÅ«ti does not destroy such provisional names as the dharma of non-forgetfulness, and speaks of the nature of dharmas such as the dharma of non-forgetfulness.
The nature of dharmas such as the dharma of non-forgetfulness is indestructible and not indestructible, therefore what SubhÅ«ti says is also indestructible and not indestructible.

Omniscience is merely a provisional name, the cognition of the path and the cognition of all aspects are merely provisional names, such provisional names are not apart from the nature of dharmas, the Venerable SubhÅ«ti does not destroy such provisional names as omniscience, and speaks of the nature of dharmas such as omniscience.
The dharma-nature of omniscience and so forth is neither destroyed nor indestructible, therefore SubhÅ«ti's explanations are also neither destroyed nor indestructible.

All dhÄraá¹‡Ä« gateways are merely provisional names, all samÄdhi gateways are merely provisional names, such provisional names are not apart from the dharma-nature, the Venerable SubhÅ«ti does not destroy these provisional names such as all dhÄraá¹‡Ä« gateways and so forth while explaining the dharma-nature of all dhÄraá¹‡Ä« gateways and so forth.
The dharma-nature of all dhÄraá¹‡Ä« gateways and so forth is neither destroyed nor indestructible, therefore SubhÅ«ti's explanations are also neither destroyed nor indestructible.

Stream-enterer is merely a provisional name, once-returner, non-returner, and arhat are merely provisional names, such provisional names are not apart from the dharma-nature, the Venerable SubhÅ«ti does not destroy these provisional names such as stream-enterer and so forth while explaining the dharma-nature of stream-enterer and so forth.
The nature of the stream-enterers and so forth is neither destroyed nor not destroyed, therefore SubhÅ«ti's explanation is also neither destroyed nor not destroyed.

translated: The approach to the fruit of stream-entry and the fruit of stream-entry are merely provisional names, the approach to the fruit of once-returning and the fruit of once-returning, the approach to the fruit of non-returning and the fruit of non-returning, the approach to the fruit of arhatship and the fruit of arhatship are merely provisional names. Such provisional names are not apart from the nature of dharmas. Venerable SubhÅ«ti does not destroy such provisional names as the approach to the fruit of stream-entry and the fruit of stream-entry, etc., but explains the nature of dharmas of the approach to the fruit of stream-entry and the fruit of stream-entry, etc.

The nature of dharmas of the approach to the fruit of stream-entry and the fruit of stream-entry, etc., is neither destroyed nor not destroyed, therefore SubhÅ«ti's explanation is also neither destroyed nor not destroyed.

The pratyekabuddha is merely a provisional name, the approach to the pratyekabuddha and the fruit of the pratyekabuddha are merely provisional names. Such provisional names are not apart from the nature of dharmas. Venerable SubhÅ«ti does not destroy such provisional names as the pratyekabuddha, etc., but explains the nature of dharmas of the pratyekabuddha, etc.
The nature of the dharmas of pratyekabuddhas and so forth is neither destroyed nor not destroyed, therefore SubhÅ«ti's explanation is also neither destroyed nor not destroyed.

The bodhisattva-mahÄsattva is merely a provisional name, the samyak-saá¹ƒbuddha is merely a provisional name, such provisional names are not apart from the nature of dharmas, the Venerable SubhÅ«ti does not destroy such provisional names as bodhisattva-mahÄsattva and so forth while explaining the nature of dharmas of bodhisattva-mahÄsattva and so forth.

The dharmas of bodhisattva-mahÄsattva are merely provisional names, unsurpassed perfect enlightenment is merely a provisional name, such provisional names are not apart from the nature of dharmas, the Venerable SubhÅ«ti does not destroy such provisional names as the dharmas of bodhisattva-mahÄsattva and so forth while explaining the nature of dharmas of the dharmas of bodhisattva-mahÄsattva and so forth.
The Dharma nature of the bodhisattva-mahÄsattvas is neither destroyed nor indestructible. Therefore, what SubhÅ«ti says is also neither destroyed nor indestructible.

The ÅšrÄvaka Vehicle is merely a provisional name, the Pratyekabuddha Vehicle and the unsurpassed Vehicle are merely provisional names. Such provisional names are not apart from the Dharma nature. The Venerable SubhÅ«ti does not destroy such provisional names as the ÅšrÄvaka Vehicle, etc., but speaks of the Dharma nature of the ÅšrÄvaka Vehicle, etc.
The Dharma nature of the ÅšrÄvaka Vehicle, etc., is neither destroyed nor indestructible. Therefore, what SubhÅ«ti says is also neither destroyed nor indestructible.
The Venerable SubhÅ«ti does not destroy provisional names in such dharmas but speaks of the Dharma nature.
The Venerable SubhÅ«ti said to Åšakra, Lord of the Devas:
As the Buddha has said, all existing dharmas are not apart from provisional names.
Bodhisattva-mahÄsattvas, knowing that all dharmas are merely provisional names, should study prajÃ±Ä-pÄramitÄ.
When bodhisattva-mahÄsattvas study in this way, they do not study form, nor do they study feeling, perception, formation, or consciousness.
It is because these bodhisattva-mahÄsattvas do not see form in which to study, nor do they see feeling, perception, formation, or consciousness in which to study.
When bodhisattva-mahÄsattvas study in this way, they do not study the eye sense base, nor do they study the ear, nose, tongue, body, or mind sense bases.
It is because these bodhisattva-mahÄsattvas do not see the eye sense base in which to study, nor do they see the ear, nose, tongue, body, or mind sense bases in which to study.
When bodhisattva-mahÄsattvas train in this way, they do not train in the sphere of form, nor do they train in the spheres of sound, smell, taste, touch, and dharmas.
Because these bodhisattva-mahÄsattvas do not see the sphere of form in which to train, and do not see the spheres of sound, smell, taste, touch, and dharmas in which to train.

When bodhisattva-mahÄsattvas train in this way, they do not train in the eye element, nor do they train in the form element, eye-consciousness element, and eye contact, or in the feelings that arise from eye contact as a condition.
Because these bodhisattva-mahÄsattvas do not see the eye element in which to train, and do not see the form element up to the feelings that arise from eye contact as a condition in which to train.

When bodhisattva-mahÄsattvas train in this way, they do not train in the ear-element, nor do they train in the sound-element, the ear-consciousness-element, and the ear-contact, and the feelings that arise from the condition of ear-contact.

It is because this bodhisattva-mahÄsattva does not see the ear-element in which to train, and does not see the sound-element up to the ear-contact and the feelings that arise from the condition of ear-contact in which to train.

When bodhisattva-mahÄsattvas train in this way, they do not train in the nose-element, nor do they train in the smell-element, the nose-consciousness-element, and the nose-contact, and the feelings that arise from the condition of nose-contact.

It is because this bodhisattva-mahÄsattva does not see the nose-element in which to train, and does not see the smell-element up to the nose-contact and the feelings that arise from the condition of nose-contact in which to train.

When bodhisattva-mahÄsattvas train in this way, they do not train in the tongue element, and they do not train in the taste element, the tongue consciousness element, tongue contact, or the feelings that arise from the condition of tongue contact.

It is because these bodhisattva-mahÄsattvas do not see the tongue element in which to train, and they do not see the taste element up to the feelings that arise from the condition of tongue contact in which to train.

When bodhisattva-mahÄsattvas train in this way, they do not train in the body element, and they do not train in the touch element, the body consciousness element, body contact, or the feelings that arise from the condition of body contact.

It is because these bodhisattva-mahÄsattvas do not see the body element in which to train, and they do not see the touch element up to the feelings that arise from the condition of body contact in which to train.

When bodhisattva-mahÄsattvas train in this way, they do not train in the eye element, and they do not train in the form element, eye consciousness element, and eye contact and the feelings that arise from eye contact as a condition.

Because these bodhisattva-mahÄsattvas do not see the eye element in which to train, and they do not see the form element up to eye contact and the feelings that arise from eye contact as a condition in which to train.
When bodhisattva-mahÄsattvas train in this way, they do not train in the earth element, and they do not train in the water, fire, wind, space, or consciousness elements.
Because these bodhisattva-mahÄsattvas do not see the earth element in which to train, and they do not see the water, fire, wind, space, or consciousness elements in which to train.
When bodhisattva-mahÄsattvas train in this way, they do not train in the noble truth of suffering, nor do they train in the noble truths of the origin, cessation, or path.
It is because these bodhisattva-mahÄsattvas do not see the noble truth of suffering in which to train, nor do they see the noble truths of the origin, cessation, or path in which to train.

When bodhisattva-mahÄsattvas train in this way, they do not train in ignorance, nor do they train in volitional actions, consciousness, name-and-form, the six sense bases, contact, feeling, craving, grasping, becoming, birth, old age and death, sorrow, lamentation, suffering, distress, or anguish.

It is because these bodhisattva-mahÄsattvas do not see ignorance in which to train, nor do they see volitional actions up to old age and death, sorrow, lamentation, suffering, distress, and anguish in which to train.

When bodhisattva-mahÄsattvas train in this way, they do not train in internal emptiness, external emptiness, internal and external emptiness, the emptiness of emptiness, great emptiness, ultimate emptiness, the emptiness of conditioned phenomena, the emptiness of unconditioned phenomena, absolute emptiness, the emptiness of the unlimited, the emptiness of dispersion, the emptiness of inherent existence, the emptiness of specific characteristics, the emptiness of general characteristics, the emptiness of all phenomena, the emptiness of non-apprehension, the emptiness of intrinsic nature, the emptiness of intrinsic nature of non-existent things, and the emptiness of the intrinsic nature of non-existent things.

Because these bodhisattva-mahÄsattvas do not see internal emptiness that can be trained in, do not see external emptiness up to the emptiness of the intrinsic nature of non-existent things that can be trained in.

When bodhisattva-mahÄsattvas train in this way, they do not train in true suchness, nor do they train in the dharma realm, the nature of dharmas, the unmistaken nature, the unchanging nature, the nature of equality, the unborn nature, the determination of dharmas, the abiding of dharmas, the reality limit, the space element, or the inconceivable element.
Because these bodhisattva-mahÄsattvas do not see true suchness in which to train, and do not see the dharma realm up to the inconceivable element in which to train.
When bodhisattva-mahÄsattvas train in this way, they do not train in the perfection of generosity, nor do they train in the perfections of discipline, patience, diligence, concentration, or wisdom.
This bodhisattva-mahÄsattva does not see the perfection of giving in which to train, and does not see the perfection of morality, patience, vigor, meditation, or wisdom in which to train.
When bodhisattva-mahÄsattvas train in this way, they do not train in the four meditations, and they do not train in the four immeasurable [minds] or four formless concentrations.
This bodhisattva-mahÄsattva does not see the four meditations in which to train, and does not see the four immeasurable [minds] or four formless concentrations in which to train.

When bodhisattva-mahÄsattvas train in this way, they do not train in the eight liberations, and they do not train in the eight superior [spheres of] perception, nine successive concentrations, or ten universal bases.

When bodhisattva-mahÄsattvas study in this way, they do not study the four establishments of mindfulness, and do not study the four right efforts, four bases of supernatural power, five faculties, five powers, seven factors of enlightenment, or eightfold noble path.

This bodhisattva-mahÄsattva does not see the four establishments of mindfulness that can be studied therein, and does not see the four right efforts, four bases of supernatural power, five faculties, five powers, seven factors of enlightenment, or eightfold noble path that can be studied therein.
When bodhisattva-mahÄsattvas study in this way, they do not study the gate of liberation of emptiness, and do not study the gate of liberation of signlessness or wishlessness.
This bodhisattva-mahÄsattva does not see the emptiness liberation gate in which to train, and does not see the signless and wishless liberation gates in which to train.
